direction.raw_text: Elizabeth is up front. She's staring,at the PARENTS. They stare right back at her. It's awkwardly silent for a beat too long.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hi, my name's Elizabeth Halsey. Soooooo... Any questions? Sasha's Mother eagerly raises her hand. Elizabeth points to her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hi, I'm Sasha's mother. We waved to each other at the carwash. I'm a little concerned with the importance you're placing on movies. What about the state test? Elizabeth points to her sign on the wall -- "Don't Question My Authority."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's exactly what I say to my students. Listen, I'm a good teacher. And the school hired me because I'm good at what I do. (as the parents take this in) And the reason your son loves my class is because I inspire him. Movies are one tool that I use. I also use other multimedia techniques, which I'm not going to get into right now. Look, I could take you day by day through my entire syllabus, but that's not how I do things. I'm not one of these stuffy teachers who's totally by the book. I talk to the kids like they're little adults. It's about mutual respect. So that's my spiel, as the Jews say. (THEN) Help yourselves to some delicious snacks and drinks in the back. Class dismissed. They head to the back of the class. ANGLE ON A "refreshments" table. A lonely package of OREOS rests against a PITCHER OF TAP WATER. Elizabeth tries to sneak out the door, but is stopped by a sharply dressed PARENT.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Excuse me, Ms. Halsey. (EXTENDING HAND) I'm Chris' dad. From Elizabeth's reaction, she clearly has no idea who Chris is.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Chris... Great kid -- and precocious. You must be so proud.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, what a relief. I just wish his grades would reflect it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If I know Chris, he'll get there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Listen, I know you have a full plate, but if you could keep an eye on Chris, my wife and I would really appreciate it. Chris' dad shakes her hand. Elizabeth opens her hand, sees a tightly folded HUNDRED DOLLAR bill. She looks back up at Chris' dad.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (WINKING) For supplies. Or whatever.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Elizabeth stands with another set of parents. They're eating Oreos and sipping water.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're Chase's parents? Great kid -- and precocious. You must be so proud. The parents beam.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A student like that would benefit so much from some extra attention.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You think we should hire a tutor? (then, to Chase's Dad) I told you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'd be happy to do it myself. It's just hard in a class of twenty-five.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, to be a teacher.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's just so hard, on my salary, having to pay for my supplies, my fiance cheated on me with his twin sister... and, unlike a lot of these other teachers, all I truly care about is helping your child learn. And as their personal tutor, I guarantee a full grade higher -- or your money back. Chase's mom takes out her check book.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Make it out to "cash."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .CUT TO:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Parents are leaving the class, ad-libbing "thank.you's." Another SET OF PARENTS surreptitiously hand Elizabeth some cash. A Bohemian mother, MELODY, wearing a beret, lingers behind.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Excuse me, Ms. Halsey. I just wanted to introduce myself. I'm Melody. Garrett's mom.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nice to meet you... Garrett's a great kid
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: and precocious. You must be so proud.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, you're referring to his poetry. Thank you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You must be so proud.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I am. So so so so so proud. So proud.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A kid like that, if I could just give some more one on one time, he would just blossom.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm so happy to hear you say that. would really benefit from that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Unfortunately, in a class of twenty- five...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ugh. Class sizes are ridiculous.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And with the amount they pay teachers...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank god you love what you do.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I guess what I'm getting at is, maybe you could help out by giving me a little -- you know -- somethin somethin. Elizabeth offers her hand, palm up. Melody stares back at her blankly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's just, it's really tough to teach the way that I want to teach when there's so little money. I mean, look at this place.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know what I'm going to do for you? Melody opens her pocketbook. Elizabeth smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I am going to start a letter-writing campaign to the school board, to my congressman, to the mayor -- and keep writing until you get what you deserve. She opens her date book and writes herself a note.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And I'm writing myself a reminder! Melody pulls Elizabeth into a warm hug.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You are a saint. Melody exits. Elizabeth is left in the classroom by herself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So long, Crazy. As Elizabeth pulls out the CASH she just made, we hear the opening beats of COOLIO'S "GANGSTER'S PARADISE."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .A.M.S. - ADMINISTRATION BULLPEN - DAY The SONG continues. Elizabeth pokes her head in. The office is empty. She walks in, grabs the "Lost and Found" box and exits.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The SONG continues. Elizabeth stands across from a
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . The pile of "Lost and Found" clothes are laid out on the counter. The Hippie Girl hands Elizabeth some cash.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The SONG continues as Elizabeth throws more money in her "New Tits" jar and enters a new amount into her notebook. The new balance: $1473.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: angster's Paradise" CONTINUES and we see that the class is now watching "Dangerous Minds" with Michelle Pfeiffer as a tough-as-nails teacher in an inner-city school.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The SONG continues as Amy, in her empty classroom, stands against the adjoining wall, her ear pressed to it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The SONG continues. The class is still watching "Dangerous Minds." There's some NOISE in the hall. Elizabeth PAUSES the movie, STOPPING the song. She leans into the hall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Enough with the commotion! The hallway goes silent. She comes back in and UNPAUSES the movie. The SONG comes back on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The SONG continues as the hallway fills with excited kids, who race down the hall and talk animatedly with friends. Elizabeth pushes through the center.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The SONG continues. Elizabeth sits in her car. She lights a joint with the cigarette lighter and deeply inhales.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! The SONG abruptly ENDS. Elizabeth jumps. She turns to her window, sees Sasha, bundled in her winter coat, waving.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (through the window) What do you want? Sasha motions for her to roll down the window. Elizabeth doesn't.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is that marijuana?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It is. But it's medicinal. Doctor gave it to me. Not that it's any of your business.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, okay. Feel better. (THEN) My mom and I made you holiday cookies. Here. Sasha pulls out a tupperware container.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (peering through window) Are those oatmeal raisin?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sugar. Elizabeth considers, then manually rolls down the window a crack. She grabs the container and quickly closes her window. Elizabeth starts eating a cookie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You have anything to drink? Sasha shakes her head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Word to the wise: stop dressing like you're running for congress.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't want to run for congress. I want to be president.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: See? That's what I'm talking about. Keep saying stuff like that, you're gonna get punched. You really want to be President or is that what your parents tell to be? Sasha shrugs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't have to decide right now. Who knows? Maybe you wake up one day and decide that you love giving massages and you want to be a masseuse. Salary plus tips. Think about it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If I think about it, will I get extra credit?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (shakes her head) Hopeless. Watch your feet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Elizabeth reverses. Sasha jumps away from the car. Elizabeth peels out, passing the school marquee that reads, "Happy Holidays, Jammers! See you in '09!"
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Elizabeth rolls over. It's 3:40 PM. She yawns and gets out of bed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Elizabeth opens her refrigerator. Nothing except ketchup packets, mustard packets and soy sauce packets. She reaches for her bong and tries lighting it. Once. Twice. She shakes the lighter. No luck. She carries the bong to the stove, turns on the stove, and tries lighting it from there. No luck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Seriously?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Elizabeth walks up to the door. It's locked. She shakes the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Seriously? She sees a HOMELESS GUY leaning against the storefront.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why's the store closed? The Homeless Guy looks at her strangely.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's Christmas.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Seriously? Elizabeth looks around. The streets are empty. Not a person in sight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Merry Christmas!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Whatever. (then, stops) Hey, you got a lighter?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't smoke. It's bad for you. Elizabeth walks back to her car, empty-handed. A MINI- VAN passes. Stops. Reverses.. The window rolls down. It's Garrett and his Mom.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ms. Halsey! Hey, it's me, Garrett!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Merry Christmas, Ms. Halsey!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Having a nice Christmas?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you doing the rest of the day? Going to see your family?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm probably going to meet up with some people. We're having a big potluck, so... Elizabeth-shuffles her feet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ms. Halsey. (then, extremely maternal) Elizabeth. Would you like to have Christmas with us?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cozy and unpretentious. Filled with crafts. Elizabeth sits next to Melody and across from Garrett, who's wearing his "Gymnastics" sweatshirt, and his TWO AUNTS, both divorced. Elizabeth tears through a plate of Christmas cuisine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is a real treat for Garrett. He doesn't have a lot of friends come by the house.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I find that hard to believe. (CHECKS WATCH) Listen, I hate to eat and run, but I've gotta head over to the shelter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I thought we could play board games!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A shelter. That is so inspiring.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, I love helping bums.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, but you have to wait for dessert. We have a real treat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If it's cheesecake, I'll stay.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's even better than cheesecake! (THEN) Garrett, why don't you run and get some of your new poetry?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (feigning. embarrassment) Oh god, no one wants to hear it. Oh god, I'm so embarrassed!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't be shy, Marbles. Garrett runs out of the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If you're not really serving dessert, I'm gonna have to get going.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: One poem? If you like it, maybe you can read it to your homeless friends.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Garrett stands in front of Elizabeth and his family. He opens his journal, clears his throat, and begins.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is called "The Chase," by Garrett Tiara. (READING)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: /My love for you is XOXO/ Her hair is long and straight / Isn't it great? / About her smile / That I would walk a mile for / About her personality / That makes me see the best in me / And at night when we sleep / Our souls locked in deep / So that when we sleep / We can stop pretending / And embrace our beautiful ending. Melody applauds. The Aunts join in. Elizabeth claps, then gets up to go. Garrett shakes them all off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She sits back down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We'll dance our dance / We'll revel in romance perchance / One glance / One dance
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because together we can achieve... (really reaching for it) Ba-lance... Thank you. He closes his journal. Everyone applauds. Melody looks to Elizabeth for a reaction.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Junior likes to rhyme.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Patty, Nancy, why don't you give me a hand with dessert -- give them a chance to talk about the poem. The women exit, leaving Garrett and Elizabeth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So your poem's about that girl?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Chase, yeah. You got the subtext.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can I give you some advice?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Number one, stop writing poetry. Two: stop reading it. And three: don't set your sights so high. I mean, she's really hot. If I were you, I'd try for that chubby girl that sits up front -- the one with the teeth? Elizabeth puts her hands to show teeth going off in different directions.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But I like Chase.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not gonna happen. Look, I was that hot girl. Hotter, even. And I never would have gone out with a kid like you. And I'm not saying that to be mean. I'm saying it to be helpful.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you know? You don't-even know our names.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll tell you what I know: a kid who wears the same "Gymnastics" sweatshirt three days a week isn't getting laid until he's 26. That's what I know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This sweatshirt was my dad's. It's all he left when he left.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, there's a reason he didn't pack it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (quiet, steely) Fuck you. Elizabeth pats Garrett on the shoulder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good luck being a loser. Thank your mom for dinner. Elizabeth heads for the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Happy New Year. Are you spending that alone, too, or do you want my mom to invite you over? She gives him the finger over her shoulder and leaves.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The students, many tanned, many with braids in their hair from their winter vacations, silently stare at Elizabeth. She looks haggard. She pulls out a bottle of cough syrup and takes a long swig. The kids look at each other, like "what is she doing?" Elizabeth lets out a lame, fake cough.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shut up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Elizabeth is-checking her makeup in the mirror. Lynn enters. Her blouse has a healthy serving of vomit on it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, welcome back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What is that, vomit? Lynn grabs some towels and blots at the stain..
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, and a little blood. The kids had too much sugar. (MORE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Anyways, a bunch of us are going out tonight to see Period 5 play. Do you want to come?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ugh. No. Elizabeth heads out. Lynn, still blotting, follows her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Elizabeth and Lynn bump into Scott.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, guys. Are you coming to 'In Cahoots' tonight? My band's doing a few songs. Could be fun.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Um, yes! That sounds like a party. (then, to Lynn) Lynn, do you want to come?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We'll all grab a drink!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Great. I need to get drunk. I mean, not drunk drunk. But a strong buzz. Still be able to drive home.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (high fives her) Now we're cooking with grease!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: & GRILL - NIGHT We hear the familiar riff of Shawn Mullin's "Lullaby."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: & GRILL - NIGHT - CONTINUOUS Scott, Sandy (with his hair down), a BALDING BASS PLAYER with a yarmulke and a HEAVY-SET DRUMMER, are playing their hearts out. This is PERIOD 5.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Amy, and a couple other teachers are front and_center, grooving to the music. Amy sways with her eyes closed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Everything's gonna be alright / rockabye... Scott joins in, harmonizing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rockabye, rockabye...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bye, bye... Bye, bye...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Elizabeth and Lynn at the bar.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Aren't they terrific? Elizabeth eye-fucks Scott. She catches his eye and he quickly smiles before nervously turning his attention to Amy. Elizabeth watches Amy dance in SLO M0, her BREASTS bouncing up and down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (staring at Amy's breasts) They're perfect.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You should hear some of their originals. She turns to the bartender.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Two more. (then, to Lynn) You want anything?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No thanks... You know, I was thinking that if you still need that money, you should.try and go for the bonus. Can't hurt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What bonus?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: For the state test. (off Elizabeth's look) (MORE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Whichever teacher has the highest scoring class gets a bonus. We talk about it all the time in the faculty meetings.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How much?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: $5700. Could be good, right? (THEN) Let's dance! Lynn runs out onto the dance floor and joins Amy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Man it's a hot one / like seven inches from the midday sun... Amy kicks her shoes off, and starts dancing. Lynn follows suit. Elizabeth throws back her drink and exits.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .A.M.S. - TEACHER PARKING LOT - DAWN The sun is breaking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Amy listens to NPR as she pulls into the empty parking lot. Suddenly, she SLAMS on her brakes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: is already there. Amy puts her car in park and gets out. She walks over to Elizabeth's car and feels the hood.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cold.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .A.M.S. - HALLWAY - MOMENTS LATER The clicking of Amy's shoes ECHO through the empty hallway. She stops, takes off her shoes. She pitter-patters down the hall to Elizabeth's classroom and PEERS in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Elizabeth is at the chalkboard, intently writing questions. She senses something in her periphery and looks over at her window. Nothing. Elizabeth goes back to work.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Elizabeth waits in the doorway impatiently as the kids filter in. Garrett brings up the rear, rolling his backpack into class.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's go, Sylvia Plath. Garrett rolls his backpack over Elizabeth's shoe.. Elizabeth winces and glares at Garrett. The rest of the class enters, stops, noticing WORK PACKETS on each of their desks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where's the TV?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Everyone, take your seats. Shawn turns to Spencer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you think's going on? Spencer shrugs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on, come on. We have a lot to cover so sit down. The class, still confused, quickly take their seats.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Alright then. Now. Open your To'Kill A Mockingbird to page one. The kids slowly take out their books. We HEAR the distinct sound of twenty-five book spines cracking as they're opened for the first time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (checking her notes) Good. Now, who can tell me why Jem cries when the hole in the tree is filled with cement? Anyone?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because she's a cry baby. The kids chuckle. Chase looks back at Garrett.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get out. Garrett clicks up the handle on his bag and heads for the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're here to learn. Anyone else have a problem with that? Good. So who has the answer to my question? Everyone looks down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nobody's read this book? It's on the syllabus.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (raising hand and answering) You never assigned it to us.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, now I am. And we're having a quiz tomorrow. Panic.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: On the first hundred pages.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: DEMONIUM.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You can't do that! I have band and jazz band tonight!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We haven't had homework all year!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey! Zip your shit! We've fallen behind, and honestly, your practice tests scores sucked balls -- which was embarrassing to me both on a personal level and as an educator. (BEAT) Things are about to change. Recess is over.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Elizabeth reads To Kill a mockingbird and highlights like crazy. She stops, takes a hit from her bong, and continues. Her roommate, Kirk, enters through the front door, sipping from a Big Gulp.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did you get my Cool Ranch? He tosses her a bag of chips.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You owe me two bucks.. Kirk walks into his room and closes the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Elizabeth paces. She has a book of stickers in her hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay, now, what is the significance of the Mockingbird in the novel? What was Harper Lee trying to tell us? No one raises their hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on, you guys know this. This is as close to real teaching as we've seen from Elizabeth. Sasha raises her hand. We see that she already has two gold star stickers on her forehead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (rolls her eyes) Anyone else? Chase raises her hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's a symbol for, um, equality? Elizabeth puts a sticker on Chase's forehead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay, good. Can anyone add to what that girl said?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The desks have been arranged into a makeshift courtroom. Spencer presides as the judge. Chase and Shawn are the prosecutors. Garrett is dressed like Boo Radley. Tristan, the bully, addresses the rest of the class -- the "jury." Everyone is clearly into the exercise.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Principal Snur, clad in a dolphin tie, watching from the back of the class.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ladies and Gentlemen of the jury, you've heard the "facts," but come on, you know me. I'm Atticus Finch, baby! The class laughs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on, seriously. You're gonna side with Chase and Shawn over me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Use examples from the book.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It doesn't matter what race the defendant is. You've just gotta look at the facts-. Elizabeth nods in agreement. The bell RINGS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good work today. And don't forget to leave your closing statements on my desk. The students all dutifully drop off their papers, placing them in a neat stack next to other ungraded PAPERS. Principal Snur exits, giving Elizabeth a thumbs up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Love the tie!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Scott and Amy share a bag of trail mix. Sandy reads a Jerry Garcia biography. Lynn grades. papers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So, you know how I hate to gossip, but I heard that one of the custodians walked in on Omar -- you know, that Arabic boy -- giving... (WHISPERS) Oral sex to Matty Feldstein after swim practice in the boy's locker room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It just starts younger and younger.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's nice to finally see the Jews and the Arabs getting along. Elizabeth enters. Scott looks up and smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, Ms. Halsey.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your shirt's mis-buttoned. Her shirt's mis-buttoned.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh shit. Hold on. Elizabeth turns away from them and starts rebuttoning. Sandy tries to sneak a peek. Scott shoots him a dirty look. Sandy gives an innocent shrug.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (grabs yogurt from fridge) I've just been such a mess the last few days. Working myself to the bone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, it's been quite a change.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Well, I think it's great. Some teachers just sail by, doing the bare minimum. It's good to know there are still some actual educators out there. Elizabeth smiles for Scott, like, "You get me."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, I should get going. Nice seeing all of you. Amy and Elizabeth smile thinly at one another. Elizabeth squeezes Scott's shoulder as she exits. Amy notices.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What a good egg.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Amy and Sasha sit in the empty auditorium. Sasha is dressed as LITTLE ORPHAN ANNIE, including the RED WIG." Student STAGEHANDS construct a set.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What else, Sasha?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know. I told you about the car wash money.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't prove that. What else?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think I've told you everything.

direction.raw_text: Don't answer right now. Let it marinate. Oh, and I should mention that if this goes to trial, I can cry on cue. Elizabeth starts crying. Everybody looks at her, aghast. And as quickly she started, she stops.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now, if you'll all excuse me, I should be heading to fifth period. I hate to be tardy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Elizabeth heads down the empty hallway. From the auditorium, the faint sound of "Tomorrow, Tomorrow" from "Annie" can be heard. Amy steps out of the auditorium, humming along to the song. She notices Elizabeth coming to her. Amy debates her options.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Elizabeth! I was so worried. You gave us quite a scare, you did. Elizabeth doesn't acknowledge her and continues walking toward Amy, only feet away now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (attempting some levity) Somebody's being a grumple--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! Elizabeth punches Amy square in the nose. Amy drops to her knees and grabs her nose, now squirting blood.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Elizabeth keeps walking and turns a corner. A BELL RINGS and the hallway starts filling with STUDENTS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.0.) Well, it's been another great year at
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . The year is winding down. Instead of gym, kids are using the time to sign each other's yearbooks. Chase walks up to Garrett with her yearbook, asks him to sign it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.0.) Who can forget the exciting addition of a climbing wall to the small gym...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . It's class photo day. With each FLASH, we
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: a different TEACHER with a different CLASS. And finally AMY, with a bandage over her nose and two black eyes, smiles widely alongside her CLASS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.0.) .Or the student/teacher spelling bee.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Much like the first scene of the movie. The teachers are sipping plastic flutes of Champagne. Principal Snur is up front. Elizabeth lingers in the back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think that was a huge s-u-c-c-a-s-s. Polite laughter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But seriously... With summer around the corner, it's time to not only say goodbye to another school year, but to also say goodbye to one of our own. Elizabeth smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Amy Squirrel. Amy, her face completely healed, steps forward, with a pursed smile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: After six short years of outstanding, tireless work here, Amy is transferring out of the district. (MORE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know she'll bring her love for learning to her new students. Sandy, the ponytailed teacher, pipes up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Speech! Speech!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Although leaving was a difficult choice... Amy looks over to Elizabeth, who motions for her to continue.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When the superintendent personally asks you to work at one of the worst schools in the state, you say yes. I'm looking forward to bringing my brand of zany energy and lust -- not love, lust -- for learning to the underprivileged students at Malcolm X High. I welcome the challenge. The Teachers applaud, Scott the most enthusiastic. Elizabeth steps up to Amy, who flinches.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Here, I got you this. Elizabeth hands Amy a poster tube. She.opens it and unravels the "Integrity" poster that Elizabeth stole.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And good luck. Somebody's gonna need it. Elizabeth heads for the door. Scott catches up to her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, Stranger. (then, whispers) Listen, now that Amy's transferring, maybe the two of us could go grab a drink.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Elizabeth walks out.
direction.name: direction

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The hallway is empty. We FOLLOW Elizabeth from behind, and as she reaches for the door to her class, we
